title: Amazon Warehouse Workers in Alabama to Hold Second Union Vote
sub_head: Amazon violated law during first election, a regional National Labor Relations Board director had found
body:
A federal labor board has scheduled a second union election at an Amazon.com Inc. facility in Bessemer, Ala., after a board representative found Amazon violated labor law during last yearâ€™s vote in which workers sided against unionization.
The National Labor Relations Board said the new election will be held by mail, with ballots being mailed to employees on Feb. 4.
